tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Professor T
programme.desc: As Professor T persuades Lisa to go behind Pauls back and help him try to prove his case, he starts to shine a different light on the prosecutions evidence.

programme.title: I Was Actually There
programme.desc: How did it feel to watch from the 92nd floor of the World Trade Center, as the first 9/11 plane hit the building opposite?

programme.title: Return To Paradise
programme.desc: When a radical eco-activist is murdered, Mackenzie and her team must figure out how the victim was killed when the suspects were chained together, unable to reach the victim.

programme.title: rage Guest Programmer: Paris Texas
programme.desc: Everybodys Safe Until... Paris Texas kick the door down and take over rage, playing you their favourite music videos from Aaron Hall, 1010BENJA, Slipknot and more.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Samantha Maiden, Tom Crowley and Matthew Knott including the PMs meeting with Trump, critical minerals, AUKUS, Kevin Rudd, environment policy plus the Nationals and Barnaby.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Alice Lolohea presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: A major critical minerals deal inked after Anthony Albanese meets Donald Trump at the White House, plus priceless jewels stolen from The Louvre in a daylight heist.

programme.title: Songs Of Praise: Edinburghs Religious Treasures
programme.desc: Claire McCollum finds out what makes Edinburghs religious buildings and history so special with a tour of some of the citys churches to see why and how they inspire our faith to this day.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grand Country Garden and Urban Design
programme.desc: Tammy explores a visionary country garden in full bloom, Sophie shares shade plant tips, Jane visits a garden rich in horticultural history, Josh discovers a biodiverse verge, and we meet a world-renowned landscape designer.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two incredible searches: a former Scotland footballer who searches for his mother after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Following a cancer diagnosis, Gary and Lorilie set out to build a multi-million dollar multigenerational family home.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang helps Kenan Thompson with a ghost clown!

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Baby Ice Bear lives alone in the arctic and meets a mysterious man named Yuri. Together they help each other survive the cold environment.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand invents a facial recognition system to keep Dr Chris out of the lab, theres a brand new quiz putting the doctors on the spot in Ouchology, and find out how to lift your mood in Mindboosters.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi must free a wild creature captured by Taborr.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Australian Politics, Elephants, Toy Story and Stray Kids
programme.desc: Four young experts match wits and dodge witticisms from host Tom Gleeson with their subjects: Australian politics, elephants, the Toy Story movies, and pop group Stray Kids!

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine prepares to meet her struggling students mother during open house, while the rest of the faculty uses the time to relax.

programme.title: Pokemon: Diamond And Pearl
programme.desc: In the Eterna Forest, our heroes meet a treasure hunter named Cheryl whos on a mission to discover the Amber Castle, which holds a special Enchanted Honey!

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand make the most of Mr Grumbles weekly shower to demonstrate how your hair has a secret skill enabling it to measure moisture in the air.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: Barry Allen/The Flash helps the gang solve mysteries Flash-style.

programme.title: Rage Guest Programmer: Ruel
programme.desc: Celebrating the release of his new album Kicking My Feet, Ruel takes over the red couch for his second stint hosting rage.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Ice Bear rides his custom vacuum into the city. But when a gang of techies steal the vacuum, Ice Bear goes on a rescue mission that takes him through the underground world of the city.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Perplexing Painting
programme.desc: When Esthers painting is damaged during the Art Show, Maudie has trouble proving who ruined the artwork without finding the evidence first.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Inaya takes Nash for a ride in her new ship.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: While preparing for bed, the Farmer manages to lock himself out of the house and is stuck outside in his pyjamas. He decides to spend the night in the barn but his incessant snoring drives the flock mad.

programme.title: Crongton
programme.desc: Liccle Bit keeps Mos return secret. After a sports day mishap, he delivers the package.

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Janine is thrilled to help introduce a new beverage to the cafeteria.

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: A hidden camera captures the birth of a litter of wolves, and a tortoise baffles the vets with a mysterious illness.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: M.I.A.
programme.desc: Marking two decades since release of her breakout debut album Arular, rage replays M.I.As 2006 rage hosting filmed while she was on tour with the Big Day Out.

programme.title: Whose Line Is It Anyway?
programme.desc: Aisha Tyler hosts another episode of the legendary improv show featuring regulars Wayne Brady, Ryan Stiles and Colin Mochrie along with guest performer Jeff Davis and star guest actress and singer Tinashe.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: With the HSC exams just days away, Bolton rallies his classmates to make their Muck-Up Day an event to remember. (Final)

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy and Scoobys favourite chef is finally opening his own restaurant but a monstrous Yeti threatens the opening night.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.sub-title: At The Bottom Of The Gyre
programme.desc: A clever machine Ant created to clean up a vast oceanic rubbish dump, has been eaten by a huge creature! Can the Nektons save Ants machine, save the creature, and try to save the planet all in one day?

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Cyborg teaches the other Titans about "real" wrestling.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Ming Dynasty Astronaut / Free Energy / Killer Ceiling Fan
programme.desc: Buster takes the hot seat in the desert for the myth of the Ming Dynasty Astronaut, plus the quest for free energy and, will Adams stunt double lose its head at the hands of the killer fan?

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: One of Britains best-loved Hollywood heartthrobs visits Bens surgery and although the mere mention of his name sends Susan weak at the knees, Ben is singularly unimpressed - at first.

programme.title: Jonestown: Terror In The Jungle
programme.desc: Sadistic preacher Jim Jones forms The Peoples Temple after an unusual childhood. Members are captivated; his lust for power becomes unstoppable.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its superhero time as the Doctors alter-egos go into battle to show the secret powers of your skin, which uses Vitamin D from the sun to make your bones strong!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: An artificial intelligence takes over a tech company.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Bajau Laut people are sea nomads living in the South China Sea, and theyre hiding a secret. When Ant and Fontaine discover the secret, theyre determined to help them. But how do you find a fish that walks?

programme.title: The Strange Chores
programme.desc: Creating some Clones to help with his long list of commitments, Pierce must confront his weakness for people-pleasing, and learn how to set some boundaries.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Its exam time, and the pressure on students is building.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.sub-title: Blown Away / Brown Note / Chinese Water Torture
programme.desc: Can you really be blown away from a bullet? Adam searches high and low for the elusive bowel-loosening tone and, is water torture real?

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Forbidden America
programme.desc: Louis Theroux immerses himself in Floridas multimillion-dollar rap scene - as notorious for its controversy as its creativity.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Kayson formally charges Lewis with negligence in the death of a patient. A customs agent brings in a suspect whose intestines are packed with contraband. Benton is called out of surgery to find his senile mother.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.sub-title: Mr Onion And Dibillo In The Tub!
programme.desc: Inside the little Toy House, everybody is very happy to see the little toy tub. In Storyland, the great big tub visits Mr Onion and he plays a game of surprises with his best friend Dibillo.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Suns out and surfs up! Beep is excited for her first day at the beach, but sand, water and pesky seagulls? Hmm... what can a robot do at the beach? Dustin shows her theres something fun for everyone.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Everyone in Hoopla loves the dragon boat festival, especially Jango who loves it because Mimi makes delicious sticky rice dumplings. Jango sneakily eats all the dumplings and pretends that there is a hungry dragon in Hoopla.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Todays sound adventure is around bells, big and small. Mole isnt so sure...

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one. At first its fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are going ice-skating today. They have never been ice skating before and Peppa keeps falling over. Daddy Pig tells her not to worry; everyone falls over when they skate for the first time.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun comes across a discarded jigsaw puzzle and calls on the Flock to help him put it together. When Bitzer discovers the final piece is missing they decide they must do whatever it takes to solve the puzzle.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli decides to become a superhero called Super Chilli! His superhero skills are put to the test when Evil Pea covers Supertato in sticky honey, but Chillis heat saves the day.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Zoe and Isadora meet Zoes annoying cousin Max, Zoe begs Isadora to shapeshift into a kitten and pretend to be her pet in order to impress Max.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: Once in a Blue Moon / Zombie Eyes Surprise
programme.desc: On Blue Moon night, Katya struggles to choose a punch flavor, while Zoe learns to control her powers after spoiling a game. Together, the Super Monsters embrace teamwork, fun, and friendship.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: Timmy cant wait to trick or treat as a Mecha T-Rex, but needs the Mechas help when he cant reach the arms of his costume.

programme.title: Room On The Broom
programme.desc: This magical tale about friendship and family follows a kind witch who invites a surprising collection of animals to join her on her broom. From the producers of The Gruffalo and The Gruffalos Child.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: A bicycle ride with Dad soon turns into an intergalactic space adventure, as Maddie + Triggs imagine themselves as brave explorers, shooting like rockets into the unknown.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Tyler needs to replace his missing dance crew. Andy and the band put their best feet forward, with some help from Cousin Macs Super Sneakers, but its a bit more choreography chaos than dancing distinction!

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do some things fall faster? Were reaching new heights to find out why some items fall faster than others. Join Alex as he creates a parachute for a toy dinosaur using a serviette.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Alicia is nervous about her driving test, so Millie and the Creato-crew build a "practice car" to help her feel more confident.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When their barber goes on vacation ahead of Robotics Team picture day, the Dream Factory Crew build a grooming robot to get themselves ready for their close-up.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Enemy Anemones
programme.desc: The Octonauts and some helpless crabs are caught between two territorial groups of aggregating anemones - and their numbers are growing!

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels play a game of Spot the Difference and youre all invited to join in!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Percy causes confusion and delay by panicking over nothing.

programme.title: Hey Duggee Songs
programme.desc: Its sing-a-long time with Duggee and the Squirrels! Sing and dance with these original songs from Hey Duggee.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The Mobile Unit learns how things might have been if they hadnt joined the team, by using What-Would-It-Have-Been-Like-Inator helmets.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Big Cuzs fund-raising sausage sizzle is a slapstick disaster when Old Dog steals the sausages...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit is to be given the Queens award for Industry for all the hard work she does. Peppa and her friends accompany Miss Rabbit to the Palace to meet the Queen!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: A game of "Grannies" is fun until Bingo and Bluey cant agree on one simple question: Can Grannies dance? Now they need to video call Nana to get the answer.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When the Squirrels find Duggee playing saxophone, they want to have a go too. The squirrels make their own musical instruments, playing pots, balloons, tins, water and tubes, but boy are they loud!

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Siblings squabble about who gets to use the garden shed. Can the band settle the argument?

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobble has lost her shoes and Moon Baby shows Colly Wobble the magical shoe tree, with different shoes growing on it. Colly Wobble tries the Wellington Boots. What a lot of splishy-sploshy fun!

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Its snowing in Mollyvale sending everyone inside. Everyone except Russell. Soon, a chilly new chum, Freezy appears, and they become best friends. When Freezy has to leave, Beep and Mort make a special keepsake.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bop has a lot of things to fix, but today he decides to make things even better than they were before.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector and Mole look for buried treasure, with surprising results.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover and as she produces her collection of Rainbow Fairy Mice and insists on playing the Goodnight Game its not long before the differences in their bedtime routines emerge.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The grass is very long. It is so long that when Peppa and George play outside they cant see each other and lose their ball. The grass is too much for Daddy Pigs rusty old lawnmower so he calls Grandpa Pig for help.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: A film crew arrives to record a rare bird nesting at Mossybottom Farm. The Farmer is delighted by all the attention, but when a cameraman films the Flock enjoying a game of cricket, drastic action is needed.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato and the Veggies, who fall into the deli counter and come face to face with the Turnip of Terror. They escape with help from the not-so-scary Turnip.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora and Mirabelle go to dragon camp where Isadora rides Dashing Dazzle, the lively one!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters Halloween party teaches Spike to persevere and shows the team how to turn messy mistakes into a fun, magical night for neighbors and friends.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The Martians help Lloyd deliver packages, but the Mechas see they keep breaking when dropped from up high.

programme.title: Peppa Pig: Peppas Pumpkin Party
programme.desc: Daddy Pig is throwing a special party. Everyone is invited, and they are all coming dressed in scary costumes. Peppa is a witch, George is a dinosaur, Rebecca Rabbit is a carrot...gone bad!

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: While playing in the garden Maddie + Triggs make a new friend named Reginald, and soon discover that crunchy leaves mean much more to this tiny little caterpillar.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Odd Sock Theo needs help to save some snails, because Gloria Greedi wants to build a car park space on their home. Andy and the Band come out of their shell to save the day.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can water travel using a piece of string? Absorb some fun facts as Michelle strings together some household items to experiment with water.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Realizing Mom could use a break from work, Millie and her friends put together their very own spa in the backyard.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory Crew, Carlos and his pet cockatiel, Leon, make new friends when another cockatiel flies into the Dream Factory and their adventures begin.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Beluga Whales
programme.desc: When the Octonauts discover a pod of Beluga Whales stranded at a breathing hole, they use music to lead them to safety.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels quiet time with Duggee is interrupted when King Tiger arrives at the door with a magic hat on, instead of his crown! He learns that whichever makes him feel the most himself is the most important hat of all.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Rajiv learns that he can be really useful with or without his crown.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.sub-title: The Weight Of The World Depends On Orla
programme.desc: Orla shares the story of how she was chosen to protect the 44-leaf clover in order to stop the villain, Jellybean Joe, from causing oddness to the Mobile Unit van.

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Take home readers - best day ever for Little J, and worst day ever for Levi!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: After smelling Granny Pigs perfume de lavender, Peppa experiments with the flowers in the garden to create her own special smell.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bored of the local playground, Dad and the kids go bush on a journey to their local creek. Cast out of her comfort zone, Blueys eyes are opened to the beauty of the natural world.

programme.title: Steve and Aneeshwar Go Wild
programme.desc: Steve and Aneeshwar meet some Asian elephants and give them a shower with a giant hose. They then meet some lemurs and discover their wild connection with the elephants.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.desc: Alice Lolohea presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: A major critical minerals deal inked after Anthony Albanese meets Donald Trump at the White House, plus priceless jewels stolen from The Louvre in a daylight heist.

programme.desc: Claire McCollum finds out what makes Edinburghs religious buildings and history so special with a tour of some of the citys churches to see why and how they inspire our faith to this day.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Spring: Grand Country Garden and Urban Design
programme.desc: Tammy explores a visionary country garden in full bloom, Sophie shares shade plant tips, Jane visits a garden rich in horticultural history, Josh discovers a biodiverse verge, and we meet a world-renowned landscape designer.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two incredible searches: a former Scotland footballer who searches for his mother after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Following a cancer diagnosis, Gary and Lorilie set out to build a multi-million dollar multigenerational family home.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Michael Tetlow.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Anthony Albanese has signed a major deal with the US President on critical minerals and secured Trumps support for the AUKUS defence agreement. But the White House meeting wasnt so smooth for US Ambassador Kevin Rudd.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Pacific
programme.desc: This week on The Pacific we dive into the regions enduring love of beauty pageants. Amid the glamour, we also explore the tensions and debates shaping the future of pageantry in the Pacific. (Season Final)

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your weekend informed and up-to-date. Fauziah Ibrahim and Thomas Oriti bring you the latest news, interviews, politics, culture, weather and global affairs. Plus sport with Jared Coote.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Alice Lolohea presents a roundup of the weeks big stories: A major critical minerals deal inked after Anthony Albanese meets Donald Trump at the White House, plus priceless jewels stolen from The Louvre in a daylight heist.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: An exclusive chat with Jennifer Lopez on new film Kiss of the Spider Woman, actor and comedian Maya Rudolph, Thai cave dive rescuer Richard Harry Harris, musician Vance Joy and singer Wilsn, plus movie critic Zak Hepburn.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: Prince Andrew loses the "Duke of York" title amid Epstein fallout. Jules and Jez unpack royal secrecy. Plus Liberals urged to stop dismissing women as "woke" or risk long-term opposition.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Mariam Saab brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you the days events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.

programme.title: Not Stupid
programme.desc: Prince Andrew loses the "Duke of York" title amid Epstein fallout. Jules and Jez unpack royal secrecy. Plus Liberals urged to stop dismissing women as "woke" or risk long-term opposition.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Mariam Saab.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong looks back at the week in news from Asia including: South Korea targets Cambodias scam industry after student death, a cargo plane crashes at Hong Kong airport, plus people across the globe celebrate Diwali.

programme.title: Planet America: Weekend Edition
programme.desc: Trump sends in a wrecking crew to demolish the East Wing of the White House. The racist group chat exposing what Young Republicans said when they thought nobody was listening plus Trumps $230 mil claim against the DOJ.

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.desc: Dr Daniel Timms, a biomedical engineer committed to developing cutting-edge cardiovascular medical devices including the total automatic heart (TAH) and advancing cardiac care, addresses the National Press Club.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: Record temperatures as extreme weather sets in across parts of the country, going against the guidelines - the rise in popularity of raw milk, plus a burning ball of space junk crashes to earth in the Aussie outback.

programme.title: Insiders
programme.desc: David Speers discusses the week in politics with Samantha Maiden, Tom Crowley and Matthew Knott including the PMs meeting with Trump, critical minerals, AUKUS, Kevin Rudd, environment policy plus the Nationals and Barnaby.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News Update

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: The latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Meredith Sheehan brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Wherever you are and whenever you need us, ABC News is here to bring you round the clock coverage of the latest news and todays stories. Plus reporters investigating issues that matter to you. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. We bring you todays events from reporters across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories. Presented by Meredith Sheehan.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Live across Australia, the latest headlines and the days top stories from ABC News. We have reporters on the ground connecting communities, telling your stories and bringing you coverage of whats happening as it unfolds.
